item.description:
http://trails.mtbr.co...

The trail is VERY flat and 4.8 miles around the outer perimeter, although shorter trails back are plentiful. This is a great space for off-leash dogs with wooded trails, water and open trails through the old bogs.

Please bring with you: water for yourself, a snack for you *and* one for your dog, a leash (just in case!), and a camera!
If your dog likes to swim, you may wish to bring towels and/or a blanket for the car ride home.

Please meet at the Elm Street entrance (in Halifax, MA) marked by a Fisheries and Wildlife sign.
Written directions to Elm St entrance:
http://www.trailbound...
OR
select 'Get Directions' and put in your address here:
http://maps.google.co...

Map of wildlife area and some more info:
http://www.mass.gov/d...
item.name: Hike at Burrage Pond Wildlife Management Area
